title: Ticket #3981: Job running with PID namespace don't get SIGQUIT, reaping
description:
When USE_PID_NAMESPACES=true, the job because pid 1, and starts to behave like init. In particular, if it doesn't install a signal handler for SIGQUIT, no process, regardless of uid, can send it the SIGQUIT signal. As a result, most jobs condor_rm'd will wait until the killing timeout to actually timeout.

Also, the job will become the parent of any descendant processes who lose their parents, and this pseudo init must also reap them, or them become zombies.

To fix this problem, we will put a mini-init wrapper between the job and the starter that handles signals and reaps needed children, but only when USE_PID_NAMESPACES = true
